file_content.text: SCORPIO cross-referenced all the data Havoc Squad and Kaliyo stole from Zakuul. When we compared the enemy's comm logs to the Spire maps, we found something unexpected.
Let me know when you get to the exciting part.
Yawn.
I knew you'd take my briefing seriously. Lana, you're up.
That relay station is our key to the GEMINI frequency. If we can decrypt it, we'll eavesdrop on the enemy and learn his plans.
Think bigger, Lana. We could send fake orders. Have Arcann's own warships blast him off the throne.
We can take over the Fleet.
You'll never get near that relay station. It's ten kilometers underground, and defended by more safeguards than we can count.
It's a good thing our data reveals every security measure in the way--and how to defeat them.
A strike team can disable the defenses right under Arcann's nose, but only if we send it in now. Our intel's turning stale as we speak.
Kaliyo and Major Jorgan are already on Zakuul. They're in position to clear the Commander a path directly to the relay station.
We are not sending that terrorist. She's done enough to my world.
Senya's right. Can't believe I had to say that....
Havoc Squad was made for this op. We have enough detonite to turn that relay station into a crater. Cut the head off the serpent, throw the Fleet into chaos.
You're trusting the fate of the galaxy to a gang of grenade-happy bucketheads? We're only getting one shot at this. Lucky for you, one shot is all I need.
Is that what you tell all your victims?
The idea has potential. She's an experienced infiltrator who survived on Zakuul for years.
She bombed my people. Never again.
Destroying the relay station is a last resort. But if things go wrong, I need someone who can get creative. That's Kaliyo.
Kaliyo, you're with me.
She's like a rancor in a glass factory. This is a mistake.
Those are my orders. They're not open to debate. Your job is to keep Arcann away from us.
My decision is final, Jorgan.
I'm already moving. Be seeing you.
You can't please everyone. But it may be prudent to consult Valkorion. He built the Spire. He may tell you how to invade it.
There's a hyperwave relay station hidden ten thousand meters beneath the Spire. It's the only source of GEMINI frequency transmissions to and from the Eternal Throne.
That's how Arcann commands the Fleet. And we know where it is.
We found Arcann's weak spot.
I thought the Throne controlled the Eternal Fleet.
Not the Throne itself?
Broadcasting a signal to thousands of ships across the galaxy takes tremendous energy. The relay station's powered by two hundred reactors tapping directly into Zakuul's planetary core.
We have a map. All we need is a route.
How do we reach that station?
Why stop there? When the Fleet's under your control, there's nothing you couldn't do with it.
If we take it out, Arcann won't only be blind, he'll be toothless. The Fleet will sit there waiting for commands that never arrive.
Or destroy all communications.
First order of guerilla warfare--disrupt enemy communications. This is a demolition op, all the way.
Destroying that relay station is a bonehead play. Send me, and you'll control the GEMINI frequency.
This Alliance will never win if we can't function as a team. I need all of you to pull together and do what's necessary.
I expect you to work together.
It's not that simple. We need to draw Arcann's attention away from our true goal. That means creating a diversion.
They're both accomplished at drawing attention. The real question is, who do you want with you at the relay station?
We also have to make Arcann miserable--and distract him from our real purpose. Havoc Squad can do that better than anyone.
A decoy mission is vital.
We won't disappoint, Commander.
There is safety in numbers... and military discipline. The mission's yours, Major--but we need a diversion.
On second thought, I agree.
Thank you, Commander. We're en route.
You want chaos? You've got it.
If we can't take control of the GEMINI frequency, we'll have to destroy it. Havoc Squad has the firepower for that job.
Major Jorgan has my vote.
Without me there to slice that relay station, Major Malfunction's suicide run will be a self-fulfilling prophecy. Give me a chance.
We need a perfect diversion, and you're the best around. Just keep it clean. No civilians, got it?
I need you as a distraction.
What about pets? Kidding.
If you're so committed to not setting off bombs, who am I to argue? Major, I need you to provide our distraction.
You won me over. You're in.
That actually worked. Hunh. This might be fun.
I hope you know what you're doing, Commander.
Don't make me repeat myself. If you want to be useful, distract Arcann's forces.
Do as you're told.
See you at the rendezvous, Commander.
If Kaliyo's idea of a distraction results in harm to my people, I'll kill her myself.
And I'll help.
